title: What are some of the best novels to read for beginners? - Quora

response.answer_text: I find this question both inane and offensive (somewhat). The OP has given almost no information about themselves - age, cultural background, education, interests etc - all of which factor into the kind of novels one would like.   Do you like science fiction? Try one of the 3 greats of Sci-fi literature - Asimov, Heinlein, and Clarke. Also throw in some Douglas Adams and Philip K Dick in there.Or specifically dystopian fiction? Fahrenheit 451, 1984, Battle Royale, The Children of Men?Are you a horror addict? Dive into the numerous works of Stephen King - Carrie, Dreamcatcher, The Stand, Salem's Lot, Misery. Also, explore the works of Poe, HP Lovecraft and Bram Stoker (especially Bram Stoker's Dracula)Or a romantic? You could start with Nicholas Sparks' works.Would you like to learn about History? If yes, what aspect of it? Ancient, medieval or modern? Focus on the rise of civilization or their demise? The great wars? Or the journals of interesting and historically significant people?Or read a few classics? Pick up Shakespeare, Dickens, Austen, Twain Fitzgerald, Tolstoy et al.Do you wanna build a snowman, er...I mean fantasy world? How about reading Lord of the Rings, The Silmarillion, A Song of Ice and Fire, Malazan, The Dark Tower Series, The Inheritance Trilogy, and The Wheels of Time saga?Or indulge in some Young Adult fiction? Harry Potter, The Chronicles of Narnia, Divergent series, The Hunger Games, etcThe point is there are millions of books already written. Some of them are good, some are not. Some of them are easy, some are not. Some of them have prerequisites - certain things you need to know before reading them - and some don't. Some are meant to be read on a rainy afternoon with a cup of tea, and some with your laptop ready, to understand what is being said. Some would appeal to the child in you, and some to the skeptic adult.  So, figure out what you want to read. And then search for "best <insert genre/style> books to read."

Hey Friends, These are lists of few books which are suitable for beginners as these books will be easy to comprehend and will give almost new dimensions to your thinking. These books have a powerful plot and will help beginners enhance their vocabulary and will drag them into the world of storytelling. I have read each of them and I strongly believe that each of them will have an influence on you for the rest of your lives. These are LEVEL ONE books for all those who fear reading but want to read. The boy in stipped pajama by John BoyneShort, crisp, easy to read but very powerful.Perfect combination of childhood innocence and German Nazi horror.Glimpse of Hitler, concentration camp and a child 2. Rich Dad Poor Dad by Robert T. Kiyosaki This book changed my life for better so I would definitely suggest reading this book.Financial teaching in form of interesting story.Gives new perspective to your thinking. 3. Many Lives many Masters by Dr. Brian Weiss If these question interests you, This book is for you.Life after death or what happens after death or what was I before i was born.Interesting and interacting narratives by someone who is expert in studying these events. 4. Animal Farm by George Orwell What if animals could protest and form groups and elect representatives as humans do.Funny yet sensative and thought-provoking piece of literature.Gives glimpse of Soviet union during communist rule.Around 100 pages, so if you are afraid of reading lenghty books you can start from this book. 5. 1984 by George Orwell Ever got worried if Facebook and Google would take all your data and uses them against you?Ever got worried if someone always keep watching you and all you do gets recorded?Ever watched Netflix web series GHOUL and thought what would happen if people were punished(same as happened in this series) for believing anything against the ruler?What if you live in a society where all you do is watched and corrected. A society where anything done or said against the head/ruler would lead you to severe punishments? This book gives you a glimpse of this.What if you lived during Hitler’s rule and made to say ‘Hail HItler’ against your wish?If book is so powerful that it might led you to think that even our present democracy could lead to such situation where your freefom would be seized and limited.If you are comfortable reading any above books and can comprehend english easily, this book is for you( Not if you find reading books difficult as this book is lengthy.) 6. The Alchemist by Paulo coelho The book's main theme is about finding one's destiny. 7. The fault in our stars by John Green This book is not about people dying but about people living it.A book that can make you laugh, cry and love at the same time.Emotional + Love and amazing piece to read.Not exactly for beginner. Might be a bit difficult for beginners. 8. Looking for Alaska by John Green It's gorgeously written -- passionate, hilarious, moving, thought-provoking, character-driven, and literary.This book is not just a love story but much more to that.It will take you in the world of teenagers, put you before their life and will not hide anything from you.WARNING: 15+ age and one such book that you would love to read in Goa summer. 9. Tuesday with Morrie by Mitch Albom  I will keep on updating this list to make it more informative and useful. I will soon mention LEVEL TWO and LEVEL THREE books. THANKS
